testcase.name: @BeforeClass configureAppium

failure.message: Appium HTTP server is not listening at http://127.0.0.1:4723/ after 20000 ms timeout. Consider increasing the server startup timeout value and check the server log for possible error messages occurrences. Node.js executable path: /usr/local/bin/node Arguments: [/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appium/build/lib/main.js, --port, 4723, --address, 127.0.0.1] Server log: [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Welcome to Appium v2.19.0 [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Non-default server args: [38;5;112m[Appium][0m { address: [32m'127.0.0.1'[39m } [38;5;112m[Appium][0m The autodetected Appium home path: /Users/administrator/.appium [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Attempting to load driver uiautomator2... [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Attempting to load driver xcuitest... [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Requiring driver at /Users/administrator/.appium/node_modules/appium-xcuitest-driver/build/index.js [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Requiring driver at /Users/administrator/.appium/node_modules/appium-uiautomator2-driver/build/index.js [38;5;112m[Appium][0m XCUITestDriver has been successfully loaded in 0.491s [38;5;112m[Appium][0m AndroidUiautomator2Driver has been successfully loaded in 0.923s [38;5;86m[HTTP][0m Could not start REST http interface listener. The requested port may already be in use. Please make sure there is no other instance of this server running already. [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Could not configure Appium server. It's possible that a driver or plugin tried to update the server and failed. Original error: listen EADDRINUSE: address already in use 127.0.0.1:4723 [38;5;112m[Appium][0m Error: listen EADDRINUSE: address already in use 127.0.0.1:4723 at Server.setupListenHandle [as _listen2] (node:net:1939:16) at listenInCluster (node:net:1996:12) at node:net:2205:7 at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:90:21)
